title: AIADMK row Live: Sasikala seeks Amma’s blessings at Marina, reaches Raj Bhavan with list of MLAs | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
4:30pm: O Panneerselvam leaves his residence for Raj Bhavan, to meet Governor Vidyasagar Rao shortly, reports ANI. 
4pm: Governor reaches Raj Bhavan in Chennai. 
3:45pm: Another AIADMK lawmaker Vaigai Selvan says appointing Sasikala as the chief minister was Madhusudanan’s proposal. “It is a sad development that he has now turned to Panneerselvam.” 
Madhusudanan, presidium chairman of AIADMK, deflected to the Panneerselvam camp on Thursday morning. 
3:40pm: TV reports now say Panneerselvam will not be receiving the governor at the Chennai airport. OPS is slated to meet Rao at 5pm on Thursday. 
Both Sasikala and OPS have been asked to meet the governor with 10 MLAs. 
3:35pm: Tamil Nadu governor Vidyasagar Rao arrives in Chennai. 
3:15pm: When questioned about Tamil Nadu’s political turmoil, home minister RajnathSingh says the issue is AIADMK’s internal matter and the Centre has nothing to do with it:ANI 
The Bhartiya Janata Party has been accused of having a hand in Panneerselvam’s revolt. 
3:10pm: Sasikala camp claims they have the support of 135 MLAs and are confident the governor will swear in Chinnamma as the Tamil Nadu CM. 
“The popular mood is with us... our aim is to get the governance in place,” says AIADMK leader Pandiarajan, adding that the MLAs have not been kept in captivity, instead they are being protected. 
“MLAs have been staying at their convenience at the hotel. They have not been forced or compelled to do anything.” 
2:50pm: Meeting between Sasikala and senior AIADMK leaders underway at Poes Garden to decide on the next course of action, reports ANI. 
2:30pm: O Pannerselvam leaves for Chennai airport to receive Tamil Nadu governor Vidyasagar Rao. 
The governor will meet Panneerselvam first at 5pm and his appointment with Sasikala is scheduled for 7.30pm. 
Read | Tamil Nadu power struggle echoes in Lok Sabha, Speaker rejects AIADMK notice 
2:10pm: “Madhusunanan will be the permanent general secretary of this party,” says Panneerselvam. E Madhusudanan is the chairman of AIADMK presidium, who worked with MGR and Jayalalithaa for over 50 years. 
2:00pm: “Everyone that Amma said she shouldn’t be in touch with are now with Sasikala at Veda Nilayam (Poes Garden),” says Panneerselvam. 
“We are fully prepared to respond to any allegations which the other camp will level against us. They should know we have information about them. ” 
1:50pm: O Panneerselvam will receive governor Vidyasagar Rao at Chennai airport. "Who is doing drama, who is a traitor is clear in this apology letter she wrote to Amma," says OPS waving #Sasikala 's 2012 letter @htTweets — Aditya Iyer (@Theadityaiyer) February 9, 2017 
Panneerselvam, brandishing the letter, says Jayalalithaa told him that Sasikala was allowed to enter the house only because she apologised. 
1:49pm: “Our senior leader Madhusudan was threatened and pressurised, even after that he stood alone to safeguard party. He helped the party grow and supported MGR throughout. We welcome him,” says Panneerselvam. “It is Sasikala who is doing dirty tricks to acquire the chair of CM, if she succeeds it will be a big blot on democracy.” 
1:48pm: “In two days time, Sasikala’s story will be over,” says AIADMK leader PH Pandian. 
1:41pm: V Maitreyan, AIADMK Rajya Sabha MP, says Panneerselvam is the “real heir of Amma.” AIADMK MP PH Pandian and former AIADMK MLA Munnusamy reach O #Panneerselvam 's residence @htTweets — Aditya Iyer (@Theadityaiyer) February 9, 2017 
1:40pm: Senior AIADMK leader Madhusudan pledges support to Pannerselvam at his residence in Chennai, reports ANI. Madhusudan says there is something suspicious about Jayalalithaa’s death, say TV reports. 
1:30pm: “On whose behest is Pannerselvam acting like this? DMK is behind him and the leader of opposition MK Stalin proved it,” says B Valarmathi, AIADMK leader. 
1:15pm: Madras high court declines urgent hearing of Habeas Corpus petitions on alleged detention of AIADMK MLAs; government says MLAs are staying in the MLA’s hostel and are free to move, reports PTI. 
1:05pm: TV reports say Panneerselvam tried to stop party MLAs from being herded by the Sasikala camp. 
12:35pm: ANI tweets pictures of Sasikala’s supporters outside Poes Garden: Chennai: VK Sasikala's supporters raise slogans in her support outside her Poes Garden residence pic.twitter.com/JPcEB8uuZd 
12:25pm: Tamil Nadu governor Vidyasagar Rao leaves from Mumbai’s Raj Bhavan for Chennai. Expected to arrive at 3:00pm. ANI now reports that VK Sasikala and AIADMK MLAs will meet him at 5 pm. 
12:15pm: Chennai police commissioner S George likely to be transferred, sources tell HT. 
11:50am : Supreme Court to hear plea by NGO Satta Panchayat Iyakkam against Sasikala being chief minister before disproportionate assets case verdict is due tomorrow at 2pm. 
11.40am: PIL in Madras high court says MLAs are being held captive. Public prosecutor tells court,“MLAs are staying at MLA’s hostel.” Tamil Nadu: AIADMK's MLAs (VK Sasikala supporters) lodged in a resort in Kalpakkam pic.twitter.com/oaimGnb4iu — ANI (@ANI_news) February 9, 2017 
11.35am: Ex-AIADMK MLAs Poonamalle, Manimaran and MM Babu arrive at O Panneerselvam’s residence. 
11:30am: AIADMK MPs are protesting in the well of the house in Rajya Sabha. In the Lok Sabha too, MPs raised slogans, demanding the swearing-in of VK Sasikala. AIADMK leader P Venugopal wanted to speak but speaker Sumitra Mahajan ignored him and called for question hour to begin. 
11:25am: Panneerselvam is finalising plans to replace top police officers including DGP Rajendran & commissioner S George by Thursday evening. 
11:15am: O Panneerselvam to issue orders to make Poes Garden residence Jayalalithaa’s memorial. 
11:00am: Sasikala sacks Puducherry former MLA Om Sakthi Sekar from AIADMK, reports ANI. 
Read | Battleground Tamil Nadu: O Panneerselvam keeps up attack as VK Sasikala tightens grip on AIADMK 
10.30am: O Panneerselvam’s writing to the banks to not allow transactions without his authorisation may not have any practical impact on the AIADMK, a senior party leader told IANS. He said there were other authorised persons to carry out banking transactions in the party. 
10:00am: Clarifying their position in the upheaval in the state, the DMK said Pannerselvam and Stalin share a very ‘political relationship’. 
“Pannerselvam and Stalin sit on opposite sides. They share a very political relationship. If the government does good, we appreciate it. If it does something bad, we criticise it. It’s a normal thing,” DMK leader TKS Elangovan told ANI. He also said it’s not completely wrong if the Congress blames the BJP. 
9:00am: Tamil Nadu government revokes suspension of former state chief secretary Gnanadesikan and geology and mines commissioner Atul Anand, reports ANI. 
Gnanadesikan was suspended last year in August from service on charges of alleged irregularities and for certain decisions on power tenders and contracts during his tenure. Anand was suspended after being accused of having links in beach sand mining. 
The suspension of both the senior bureaucrats was issued by late chief minister J Jayalalithaa after a high-level meeting last year.
